page.title: 13EDUCATION
page.content: Formal schooling begins in September following a child's fourth birthday at the Church Aided Infant and Junior School. The School housed in two buildings caters for 170 children seeking to give them a good foundation in language and number and see them develop fully physically, socially and spiritually. A voluntary selection test at 11+ enables some children to go to the Stratford Grammar Schools or,in the main to Kineton High School. The High School opened in 1957 as a 'neighbourhood' school serving a wide area. A large scale bussing operation transports the 1300 students, daily. A system of assesment in every subject each half term monitors students' progress. There is a uniform in black, scarlet and silver, including crest of a silver crown.
